class.name: Timer
class.description: Counts down a specified interval and emits a signal on reaching 0. Can be set to repeat or "one-shot" mode. [b]Note:[/b] To create a one-shot timer without instantiating a node, use [method SceneTree.create_timer].

method.name: is_stopped
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the timer is stopped.

method.name: start
method.description: Starts the timer. Sets [code]wait_time[/code] to [code]time_sec[/code] if [code]time_sec > 0[/code]. This also resets the remaining time to [code]wait_time[/code]. [b]Note:[/b] This method will not resume a paused timer. See [member paused].

members.member: If [code]true[/code], the timer will automatically start when entering the scene tree. [b]Note:[/b] This property is automatically set to [code]false[/code] after the timer enters the scene tree and starts.
If [code]true[/code], the timer will stop when reaching 0. If [code]false[/code], it will restart.
If [code]true[/code], the timer is paused and will not process until it is unpaused again, even if [method start] is called.
The timer's remaining time in seconds. Returns 0 if the timer is inactive. [b]Note:[/b] You cannot set this value. To change the timer's remaining time, use [method start].

constants.constant: Update the timer during the physics step at each frame (fixed framerate processing).
Update the timer during the idle time at each frame.
